attributes.action: Ensure Matt Hancock resigns from his role as health secretary
attributes.additional_details: I believe he has truly disrespected the public and made a mockery of us as human beings. He as health secretary could not even follow his own rules of social distancing, not hugging friends and family and so forth, as he repeatedly told the UK public we needed to do in order to save lives. People have not been able to console dying family members due to lockdowns and the rules. This is disgusting and an apology is not enough.
attributes.background: I would like the government and parliament to stand up and ensure Matt Hancock is no longer health secretary. Evidence has emerged that he broke lockdown rules during the coronavirus pandemic despite urging UK public to stay home to save lives. To not hug friends and family. To socially distance.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for MPs or Ministers to be sacked or for them to resign.

Since you started your petition, Matt Hancock has resigned and Sajid Javid has been appointed Secretary of State for Health and Social Care.

You can read Matt Hancock's resignation letter and the Prime Minister's response here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/matt-hancocks-resignation-letter-and-the-prime-ministers-response

And you can read the press release announcing the appointment of Sajid Javid as Secretary of State for Health and Social Care here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/the-rt-hon-sajid-javid-mp-appointed-secretary-of-state-for-health-and-social-care
